toc_entry.title: Faces Of the West
toc_entry.description: A collection of black and white portraits that capture the powerful effects of the West upon its people, with an introduction by Larry McMurtry.

toc_entry.title: The Final Gun
toc_entry.description: In a small East Texas town a black principal and a white coach loved the same woman. First came the gossip. Next came the strange letters. And then there was a murder.

toc_entry.title: What's the Big Deal About Grills?
toc_entry.description: Hot, hot, hot! Here’s why grills have become the trendiest of the trendy restaurants in Texas.

toc_entry.title: Roaming the Range
toc_entry.description: Follow that ribbon of highway to discover the breathtaking River Road, a beer-drinking goat, fabulous fajitas, and the ghostly cavalry of Fort Davis-all in the vast vacation resource known as West Texas.

toc_entry.title: The Fabric Of Dreams
toc_entry.description: Florid fashions of smooth silks and soothing satins.

toc_entry.title: Sovereign Of the Sky
toc_entry.description: Train a dog and you have a friend. Train a falcon and you have an emblem of medieval majesty.

toc_entry.title: Lily Buds, Tree Ears, And Fish Sauce
toc_entry.subtitle: Cooking
toc_entry.description: With just a nip of nuoc mam you’ll be on your way to the cooking frontier of Vietnamese food.

toc_entry.title: Don’T Talk To Strangers
toc_entry.subtitle: Fatherhood
toc_entry.description: Of course parents do everything they can to protect their children. But at some point they must learn to let go.

toc_entry.title: How To Make Your Dream House Come True
toc_entry.subtitle: Architecture
toc_entry.description: A guide to getting the most out of an architect and custom-building a home, with grace and aplomb.

toc_entry.title: Swinging With Zoot
toc_entry.subtitle: Jazz
toc_entry.description: From the moment tenor saxophonist Zoot Sims sounded his first note to just before his death four decades later, he performed with irresistible spirit and intensity.

toc_entry.title: Restless Itch
toc_entry.subtitle: Movies
toc_entry.description: Songwriter is like a great party; Kiss of the Spider Woman doesn’t connect; Mad Max Beyond Thunderdome runs out of gas; Key Exchange is too cute; Disney’s Black Cauldron isn’t for kids.

toc_entry.title: Behind the Lines
toc_entry.description: Turn right for heaven.

toc_entry.title: Back Roads
toc_entry.description: Skinner Brown, a 63-year-old farmer and businessman, was a pillar of his small-town society until he was busted for possessing $12 million worth of marijuana.

toc_entry.title: Post-Modern Times
toc_entry.description: The dream date of the eighties? One with girl-next-door looks and a credit card machine tucked in her handbag.

toc_entry.title: Downtown
toc_entry.description: It doesn’t matter whether you’re a developer with a million-dollar idea or a homeowner with a yen to remodel. You can’t bend any rule at all without approval from the Board of Adjustment.

toc_entry.title: Around the State
toc_entry.description: A selective statewide guide to entertainment and events...

toc_entry.title: Reporter
toc_entry.description: A question of honor in San Antonio; Christian harmony in Dallas; a wage dispute in Houston

toc_entry.title: The Roar Of the Crowd
toc_entry.description: Reading all about it; making the best of it; putting it on the map.

toc_entry.title: Puzzle
toc_entry.description: Exercises in new math.

toc_entry.title: State Secrets
toc_entry.description: Looking for a place to go in Galveston; Coastal’s pension pipeline; John Hill for the defense; fallout from the East Texas congressional race.
